title: Compute! Magazine Issue 109
description: Compute! Issue 109 - June 1989. Editorial License Science fact, science fiction - love 'em both, leave 'em both. It just depends on whether there's a computer around - News & Notes Sports on the wire, college on a disk, Apple on Beatles' bad list, and more news on our home computer - Gameplay If you think of computer games as art, then game designers are artists - Impact - Understand the miracles and wonders of science with your personal computer - Discoveries Computing isn't tough, not any more. So what's your excuse? - Letters Piracy and the ST: The Falcon debacle - New Products - Laptop with weight, finance update, chopper that's great, and more new products of late - Compute Specific MS-DOS - Compute Specific 64/128 - Compute Specific Apple II - Compute Specific Amiga - Compute Specific Macintosh - Compute Specific Atari ST - Science! Watch your computer mutate into a scientific wonder with the right software. Seventeen topnotch packages make science fascinating and fun - Light-Years and Lasers Science Fiction Inside Your Computer Alien worlds, alien races, alien adventures. An award-winning SF writer turns 11 science-fiction games inside out - Power Home Computing Pack power into your PC for hotshot play or high-tech home working. Dozens of products that upgrade your PS, Mac or Amiga for less than $1,000 - Buyer's Guide Historical Games Relive history, then change it, with one of these 51 historical games - Reviews Fast Looks - Kings of the Beach - Reviews Fast Looks - Apple II Video Overlay Board - Reviews Fast Looks Project Firestart - Reviews Fast Looks MenuWorks - Review PC Tools Deluxe, Version 5.0 - Review Who Framed Roger Rabbit - Review Leisure Suit Larry II: Looking for Love (In Several Wrong Places) - Review College Explorer - Review Abrams Battle Tank - Review TV Sports Football - Review Geometry - Review Twilight Zone: Crossroads of Imagination - Review Cartooners - Review Flodd, the Bad Guy - Review Publish It! Lite! - Review WriteNow 2.0 - Review Hometown, U.S.A.
